ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learning to use Solidworks
I learned how to build models inside of SolidWorks, as well as create animations and simulations.
I learned how to use Solidworks and the basics of CAD
some Solidworks but honestly if you start the class with a decent basis you won't learn much
Solidworks basics and some FMEA analysis through Solidworks
solidworks and creativity
The basics of Solidworks
I learned about Solidworks animations and simulations
I learned how to use Solidworks and its simulations for Finite element analysis
Learned how to use SolidWorks part/assembly modeling, and how to do basic motion/other types of studies.
I learned multiple functions of CAD, specifically SolidWorks, including how to design, model, assemble, draw, and test designs in SolidWorks.
I learned about how to use SOLIDWORKS features.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course has a lot of support from its teaching staff and is generally easily paced. I would recommend this for people who want to learn to use the Solidworks software without a lot of stress.

The course was often very engaging and hands-on, however I thought some of the lectures felt a bit unhelpful to the projects we were doing in class and I think more hands-on projects would have been better.

Strengths: it's a very open-ended and flexible class. You can work on whatever you want for the final project and other assignments. You are also given multiple opportunities to fix assignments after you turn them in, which is comforting. 
Weaknesses: there isn't much structure to the class.

strength: very little work
weakness: don't learn much as you could i guess

strengths:
- learning in a low-pressure environment
- assignments are really fun
- teaching team was always helpful and happy

weaknesses:
- bit of disorganization at first since some computer wasn't working

The final project kind of came out of left field. The whole class was just creating and then the final project was creating and modeling. I would rather have had a final project that was something like "make a project that includes a gear, a few premade parts, and 20 parts made by you"

I liked the mastery-based learning format of the course -- it allowed me to learn CAD in a very enjoyable, low-stress way. I also liked the flexibility in the assignments because it allowed me to pursue things that I found interesting while still learning the key skills of the course. I thought the class sessions could be a bit more organized and more hands-on practice.
Wish it was on zoom because the 6pm class time was awful which made attendance hard

The assignments or CAD models were pretty fun to work on each week and were pretty low-stakes.

I think that if we could spend more time learning how gears work or how to make part drawings other than in the first weeks assignments, it would have been beneficial. I also would've enjoyed doing more assignments on 4 bar linkages and cam followers.

A strength of this course is the open-ended final project which lets students design and test anything they desire and get familiar with testing functions not directly taught in class. A weakness could be the unorganized structure of the course, as it never known what each class would entail and how what we learned related to the course at large.

The strength of this class is that ti allows each student to make of it what they will. The weakness is that it doesn't really teach us anything that we can't learn from YouTube. All of the tutorials were already built into the program and we weren't really learning anything new in any of the lectures. This is listed as an upper level engineering course but it was at a high school level at its best.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It is a well-taught course and teaches you what you need to know in navigating and working on Solidworks. Even as a non-engineering major, I found this course to be accessible.
Absolutely, if you want a low-stress chance to learn SolidWorks, or this class helps fill a requirement of some kind for you, stop reading this and register for the course.
Yes! You learn a lot of interesting stuff about Solidworks.
easiest meche elective, so if you need that, this is a good option. if you already know some solidworks its not too useful though.
Yes! It's a great introduction to Solidworks.

Absolutely. I took this course as someone who knew nothing about engineering and Solidworks, and I had a wonderful time learning about both. The course is organized in a way that allows for complete beginners to Solidworks to get started, but if you already happen to have some CAD experience, you'll have even more fun with the more creative projects!
yes. fun class and you learn a good computer program.
If you want to learn the basics of solidworks, yes I highly suggest.
Yes, this was a great course if you're interested in learning CAD. It didn't add much stress to my life, and I felt like I developed a decent understanding of something super useful.
If you are a MENG major and need an easy class, take this!
Yes If they want to learn more about using Solidworks or simulations.

Definitely recommend this course! SolidWorks is a very useful skill and this course makes it accessible to people from all majors/backgrounds. The workload was very manageable, but the final project shouldn't be underestimated.

If they are interested in computer-aided design then this class would be helpful as it teaches the basics of SolidWorks. This course is unhelpful to students already with CAD experience or who want a rigorous challenge.
I would not recommend this course. It is very low time commitment which makes many students like it but at a certain point its not even worth taking the course if you don't get ANYTHING out of it.
